data.title: chump, n. â€” Greenâ€™s Dictionary of Slang
data.text:
Leaves from Diary of Celebrated Burglar 101/2: I immediately â€˜officedâ€™ to him what was up so as to keep his â€˜chumpâ€™ still, and they passed by and went in the direction of the skittle ground. Wild Boys of London I 37/1: â€˜Heâ€™ll know my chump again.â€™ [...] â€˜Whatâ€™s a chump?â€™ â€˜Something as is good looking. Yours is a horful phisog.â€™. Hotten Sl. Dict. â€˜â€™Arry on Fashionâ€™ in Punch 10 Sept. 110/1: Not up to the nines, not O.K., with last Seasonâ€™s tile on my chump. â€˜â€™Arry in â€™Arrygateâ€™ (Second Letter) in Punch 15 Oct. 169/2: Weâ€™ve conjurers, worblers, phrenologists! One â€™ad a go at my chump. â€˜Doss Chiderdossâ€™ â€˜When Love Beganâ€™ The Sporting Times 8 Feb. 1/3: A flare-up on Bank Holidays, with mirth, and dance and song, / Till their chumps are on the ache in evâ€™ry splinter. â€˜Doss Chiderdossâ€™ â€˜Cost Of Livingâ€™ Sporting Times 25 June 1/4: As a last resource, he asked a friend who had a wiser chump / To resolve his doubts, and save him from a chronic state of â€˜humpâ€™. M. Marples Public School Slang 96: HEAD: Of the forty-two slang synonyms for head listed by Farmer, only block, chump, napper, nob and nut are associated with schools.

N.Y. Times 28 Feb. 10/5: First of all, he [a burglar] introduced me [a reporter] to a new slang word. [...] I discovered that anybody was a â€˜chumpâ€™ who did not thoroughly understand his business. Sporting Life 27 May 4: Maybe Manager Bancroft isnâ€™t regarded as a chump by baseball people. Louisiana Democrat 14 Feb. 1/6: Well she must think Iâ€™m a bloominâ€™ chump. Leics. Chron. 3 May 1/1: What a chump of wood I must have been to go drinking cham! Bulletin (Sydney) 19 Sept. 22/3: â€˜We say it without fear of contradiction, Billy was as square as a chessboard. He was no chump. He never killed a man without cause. He never forgot to settle his score on the slate.â€™. N.Z. Observer and Free Lance (Auckland) 20 Mar. 23/1: Young cock sparrow looks a deuce of a chump in the navalâ€™s rig-out. Pretty cocky! Wichita Eagle (KS) 24 Dec. 7/1: What excuse can possibly be offered for such words as [...] â€˜sardine,â€™ â€˜chumpâ€™ [etc.]. Crowe Aus. Sl. Dict. 17: Chump, a fool, â€˜off his head,â€™ insane. Mirror of Life 16 Feb. 14/1: â€˜You must think that Iâ€™m a chump that canâ€™t see past the end of my noseâ€™. Ade Artie (1963) 14: That chump had a full house, nines on somethinâ€™. Boyâ€™s Own Paper 12 Jan. 232: What a chump old Holman was! Sydney Sportsman (Surry Hills, NSW) 4 Sept. 2/6: Innercent enuff, like chumpkins, / [...] / For itâ€™s chokey if they fail. Sun. Times (Perth) 17 July 1/1: In the missive the innocent referred to her future husband as a â€˜bald-headed old chumpâ€™. W.M. Raine Wyoming (1908) 149: See what yâ€™u done, yâ€™u blamed chump! D. Stewart Shadows of the Night in Illus. Police News 22 June 12/1: â€˜I shouldnâ€™t have thought heâ€™d haâ€™ been such a wooden-headed chump as to try and escape from the Stone Jug at Portlandâ€™. G. Bronson-Howard Enemy to Society 288: You, you chumps, you thick heads, you snivelling, drivelling fools, youâ€™ll wear striped suits and wield pickaxes and answer to a number. Sport (Adelaide) 17 July 4/6: â€˜Chumps thou wert; to chumps returnestâ€™ . Wodehouse Psmith Journalist (1993) 338: If the People are chumps enough to elect you, then they deserve you. H.C. Witwer Fighting Blood 82: What a chump Judyâ€™d be to even hesitate over a choice there, hey? Weston & Lee [perf. Bromley Carter] â€˜Bachelor Benâ€™ ðŸŽµ My married friends laugh and declare Iâ€™m a chump / But when I see their wives, I think,â€˜Umph! Iâ€™m no gumpâ€™. M.C. Sharpe Chicago May (1929) 122: We had been posing as English travellers, but what does the chump do but answer the detectives in French that would do credit to an educated native. D. Runyon â€˜Broadway Financierâ€™ in Runyon on Broadway (1954) 209: She can see that he is nothing but a hundred-per-cent chump. D. Maurer Big Con 140: A good outsideman [...] always has a chump to play for. Lait & Mortimer USA Confidential 32: Still other schemers figured they were chumps to be satisfied with merely legitimate trucking profits. R. Blount Jr About Three Bricks Shy of a Load 10: â€˜Somebody you slap in the face and he donâ€™t do anything. Thatâ€™s the definition of a chumpâ€™. F. Norman Dead Butler Caper 91: None of my business of course, not being the kind of chump who undertook murder investigations. T. Blacker Fixx 161: It afforded me no pleasure whatsoever to see him make such a complete and utter chump of himself. Eble Campus Sl. Mar. 2: chumpie â€“ insulting reference to another person, more frequently used in a friendly way as a joking insult. â€˜Look at that chumpie over there. He thinks heâ€™s bad.â€™. J. Wambaugh Golden Orange (1991) 51: We take down the chump. Guardian Rev. 25 June 5: Her useless chump of a husband lands them both in the brown stuff. Guardian Rev. 26 Feb. 8: But they blew it; they all turned out to be chumps. G. Iles Turning Angel 380: Why is Drew the worst kind of chump, Quentin? A. Steinberg Running the Books 173: A well-intentioned chump holding a shank for some inmate.
